summary: The diff adds backend/migration.mo and modifies backend/main.mo to introduce a static resource mapping function. However, the implementation is severely incomplete relative to REQ-25 and REQ-26. Only a handful of skill/level/day combinations are defined — far fewer than the required 2–3 resources for all 6 supported skills × 7 days × skill levels. The migration logic exists structurally but falls back to empty arrays for most combinations, violating the core acceptance criteria.

missing_requirements.requirement: Every supported skill (Public Speaking, Python, Excel, UI Design, Photography, Writing) has exactly 2–3 resource objects defined per day (Days 1–7) in the backend mapping.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff only defines a small handful of switch cases. The vast majority of skill+level+day combinations fall through to the default case returning empty arrays, violating the AC requiring non-empty resources for all 7 days of each skill.

missing_requirements.requirement: Custom/unsupported skills fall back to a generic set of real resource links rather than an empty array.
missing_requirements.reason: The wildcard default case in both main.mo and migration.mo returns an empty array for any unsupported/custom skill, directly violating the requirement for a generic real-URL fallback.

missing_requirements.requirement: All 7 days for each skill return a non-empty resources array when a plan is fetched.
missing_requirements.reason: Because most day indices for most skills hit the wildcard default and return empty arrays, the vast majority of days across all skills will return empty resource arrays.

missing_requirements.requirement: Skill level (Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced) influences resource selection where multiple variants are defined for the same skill+day.
missing_requirements.reason: Only a few cases distinguish by level (e.g., public speaking day 0 has beginner/intermediate/advanced variants). For Python, Excel, UI Design, Photography, and Writing, level-based differentiation is absent or minimal across most days.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each day in every stored plan has 2–3 resource entries populated with real URLs from the new fixed mapping after migration.
missing_requirements.reason: migration.mo getResourcesForDay has the same sparse switch table as main.mo and defaults to empty arrays, so migrated plans will still have empty resource arrays for most days.

missing_requirements.requirement: Plans with unsupported/custom skill names receive the generic fallback resource links rather than empty arrays.
missing_requirements.reason: migration.mo default case returns an empty array for unrecognized skills, providing no fallback resources.
